procedures.title: Liquid Waterproofing Membrane Application

steps.title: Surface Preparation
steps.description: Clean the surface thoroughly to remove dirt, dust, loose particles, and contaminants
details: Use pressure washing or wire brushing
Remove all efflorescence and salts
Ensure surface is clean and dry or slightly damp
Fill large cracks with appropriate crack filler
Repair any damaged areas before application

steps.title: Surface Drying
steps.description: Allow adequate drying time if high moisture is present
details: For damp surfaces, wait 2-4 hours
For wet surfaces, allow 24 hours drying
Ensure surface is not actively weeping water
Verify moisture content with moisture meter if available

steps.title: Primer Application (if required)
steps.description: Apply primer on highly absorbent or porous surfaces
details: Use recommended primer for specific membrane
Apply one thin coat with brush or roller
Allow primer to dry per manufacturer instructions
Typical drying time: 2-4 hours
Primer helps achieve uniform coverage

steps.title: First Coat Application
steps.description: Apply the first coat of liquid waterproofing membrane
details: Stir the membrane thoroughly before use
Apply with a paint roller or spray application
Ensure uniform thickness of 1.5-2.0 mm
Apply in overlapping passes
Work from one side to the other systematically
Pay special attention to joints and corners

steps.title: Drying Between Coats
steps.description: Allow adequate drying time before second coat
details: Wait 4-6 hours in normal conditions
Extended time needed in high humidity or low temperature
Surface should be touch-dry before second coat
Check for any defects or missed areas

steps.title: Second Coat Application
steps.description: Apply second coat perpendicular to first coat
details: Apply in perpendicular direction for complete coverage
Maintain uniform thickness
Ensure no thin spots or pinholes
Total thickness should be 3.0-4.0 mm for two coats

steps.title: Curing
steps.description: Allow proper curing time before water exposure
details: Wait minimum 7-14 days before water exposure
Temperature affects curing: 5°C to 35°C optimal
Avoid foot traffic during initial curing
Keep area well-ventilated
Protect from rain or direct water spray for first 48 hours

steps.title: Final Inspection
steps.description: Inspect the finished membrane for quality
details: Check for complete coverage
Verify no thin spots or pinholes
Ensure proper adhesion at all edges and corners
Document inspection with photographs
Record date and environmental conditions

safetyPrecautions: Avoid skin contact with uncured membrane
Keep area clear of unnecessary personnel
Have first aid kit available on site
qualityChecklist: All joints and corners properly sealed

procedures.title: Polymer Modified Concrete Adhesive Application

steps.title: Substrate Preparation
steps.description: Prepare concrete substrate for adhesive application
details: Clean substrate with wire brush or grinding machine
Remove all loose concrete and contaminants
Ensure surface is hard and solid
Remove any old adhesive or coatings
Use pressure washing if heavily soiled
Surface should be dust-free

steps.title: Surface Conditioning
steps.description: Condition surface for optimal adhesive bonding
details: Dampen surface with water 24 hours before application
Surface should be damp but not wet or weeping
Excess water should be removed with cloth or squeegee
Surface should be 'damp-dry' for best results

steps.title: Adhesive Mixing
steps.description: Prepare adhesive for application
details: For ready-to-use: ensure proper consistency
For powder form: mix with specified water ratio
Use mechanical mixer for uniform consistency
Mix time: typically 3-5 minutes
Let mixed adhesive rest for 2-3 minutes
Remix gently before application

steps.title: Adhesive Application
steps.description: Apply adhesive to substrate
details: Use notched trowel for uniform distribution
Apply adhesive to substrate or bonded material
Maintain consistent ridges of approximately 5mm
Work area should be manageable in 30-45 minutes
Apply adhesive evenly without gaps
Recommended coverage: 4-5 kg/m² at 3mm thickness

steps.title: Material Placement
steps.description: Place tiles or concrete elements into adhesive
details: Press tiles firmly into adhesive bed
Ensure complete contact between tile and adhesive
Use slight twisting motion for better bonding
Use tile spacers for consistent joint width
Work from bottom to top on vertical surfaces
Maintain proper joint alignment and level

steps.title: Curing Time
steps.description: Allow adhesive to cure before grouting or loading
details: Initial set: 24 hours minimum
Full cure: 48 hours before grouting
Do not subject to loading or traffic during cure
Temperature affects curing: 5°C to 40°C optimal
Higher humidity may extend curing time
Protect from rain or water spray

steps.title: Final Inspection and Grouting
steps.description: Inspect bonded material and proceed with grouting
details: Check for hollow spots by tapping
Verify tiles are level and properly aligned
Ensure no movement when pressure applied
Once cured, remove spacers and apply grout
Document installation with photographs

safetyPrecautions: Use dust masks when grinding surfaces
Keep electrical equipment away from water

procedures.title: Acrylic Protective Coating Application

steps.title: Surface Assessment
steps.description: Assess existing surface condition and plan preparation
details: Inspect for cracks, spalls, and defects
Identify heavily stained or discolored areas
Check moisture and salt content if applicable
Take surface profile measurements if needed
Photograph existing conditions for documentation

steps.title: Surface Cleaning
steps.description: Remove dirt, algae, and surface contaminants
details: Use pressure washing at 200-300 bar pressure
For heavily soiled areas: use chemical cleaner
Remove all algae, mold, and biological growth
Allow cleaner to work for specified time
Rinse thoroughly with clean water
Ensure all soap and cleaner residue is removed

steps.title: Repair of Defects
steps.description: Repair cracks and damaged areas before coating
details: Fill cracks wider than 2mm with crack filler
Fill spalls and surface voids with patching mortar
Allow adequate curing of repairs
Sand smooth any protruding repairs
Ensure all repairs are fully cured before coating

steps.title: Surface Drying
steps.description: Allow surface to dry completely before coating
details: After pressure washing, allow 24-48 hours drying
Check moisture content with moisture meter
Surface should be dry to touch
In humid conditions, use ventilation fans
Do not apply in rain or high humidity (>85%)

steps.title: Primer Application
steps.description: Apply primer for enhanced adhesion and uniform color
details: Use high-quality concrete primer
Apply with roller at 8-10 m²/liter coverage
Ensure uniform coverage without gaps
Allow 2-4 hours drying between primer and topcoat
Some areas may need two primer coats

steps.title: First Coat Application
steps.description: Apply first coat of acrylic protective coating
details: Stir coating thoroughly before use
Apply with high-quality paint roller
Coverage: 8-12 m²/liter per coat
Maintain consistent thickness
Apply in overlapping parallel passes
Ensure no thin spots or bare areas
Pay attention to edges and corners

steps.title: Drying Between Coats
steps.description: Allow adequate drying time before second coat
details: Dry time: 2-4 hours depending on temperature
Lower temperature and higher humidity extend drying
Ensure surface is completely dry to touch
Do not apply second coat if surface feels tacky
Environmental conditions affect drying time

steps.title: Second Coat Application
steps.description: Apply second coat for complete coverage and protection
details: Apply second coat in perpendicular direction
Maintain uniform thickness
Ensure complete coverage without pinholes
Total coverage provides enhanced protection
Allow adequate drying after second coat

steps.title: Curing and Walkway Opening
steps.description: Allow full curing before allowing foot traffic
details: Surface sets to touch in 2-4 hours
Do not allow foot traffic for 24 hours
Light foot traffic after 48 hours
Full cure time: 7 days
Protect from rain for first 48 hours if possible
Optimal curing temperature: 15°C to 25°C

steps.title: Final Quality Inspection
steps.description: Verify final coating quality and appearance
details: Inspect for uniform color and appearance
Check for complete coverage
Verify no wet spots, runs, or sags
Ensure no pinholes or bare spots
Walk surface to check adhesion
Document final condition with photographs
Record project details and materials used

safetyPrecautions: Use appropriate respiratory protection if needed
Use fall prevention equipment on elevated surfaces
Keep area cordoned off during application and curing
Have safety data sheet available on site
qualityChecklist: Second coat applied for enhanced protection
No runs, sags, or application defects
